Articles.Content:
and is starting on hard career!

Stayputnik forever!

http://classic.wunderground.com/blog/JeffMasters/comment.html?entrynum=2909
I think he means the radar device...
You do know almost all radar devices look like that
It's called a radome (pronounced Ray-Dome) and it is there to protect the radar from inclimate weather such as snow buildup.

Talking about radar, I kind of interested in seeing this thing in KSP:

Though the problem is, I have no idea what the kerbals would need such a big radar for on a plane.

Talking about radar, I kind of interested in seeing this thing in KSP:

http://www.abc.net.au/news/image/388752-3x2-940x627.jpg

Though the problem is, I have no idea what the kerbals would need such a big radar for on a plane.

Watching the little green line go around the display in their spare time.

Talking about radar, I kind of interested in seeing this thing in KSP:

http://www.abc.net.au/news/image/388752-3x2-940x627.jpg

Though the problem is, I have no idea what the kerbals would need such a big radar for on a plane.

Snack locator, things that Jeb has messed with finder, landing helper (doesn't work if Jeb is pilot, he turns it off).

Talking about radar, I kind of interested in seeing this thing in KSP:

http://www.abc.net.au/news/image/388752-3x2-940x627.jpg

Though the problem is, I have no idea what the kerbals would need such a big radar for on a plane.

Orbital/Aerial survey of a planet. Radar bounces down, comes back. Kerbals happy because they have SCIENCE! on the exact topography.
